org.xlattice.util.threads

Class JobQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.util.threads.JobQueue

  • public class JobQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    A queue of fixed or variable-length capacity. This is a thin wrapper around Queue, adding
    • the notion of capacity
    • a type for the objects stored in the queue, Runnable
    • the constraint that these objects must not be null
    This class is not thread safe. Using methods must provide external synchronization.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

      static int MIN_CAPACITY 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobQueue(int n)
      Create a JobQueue of fixed capacity if n is positive and of indefinite capacity if n is -1;

    • Method Detail

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        If the list is of fixed capacity, returns that fixed capacity; otherwise returns -1, denoting a variable-length list.
        Returns:
        the current capacity of a fixed-length list or -1

      • dequeue

        public java.lang.Runnable dequeue()
        Remove first object from the queue, if there is such a first object. If there is no such first Runnable, returns null.
        Returns:
        that first Runnable, which is also removed, or null

      • enqueue

        public boolean enqueue(java.lang.Runnable o)
        Add object at the end of the queue. The object may not be null.
        Parameters:
        o - Runnable being added to the queue
        Returns:
        whether the operation succeeded

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

      • size

        public int size()
